org.jay3d.engine.core.components

Class SpotLight

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jay3d.engine.core.components.GameComponent
      • org.jay3d.engine.core.components.BaseLight
        • org.jay3d.engine.core.components.PointLight
          • org.jay3d.engine.core.components.SpotLight

  • public class SpotLight
extends PointLight
    SpotLight is a child class of PointLight, which uses cutoff on top of colour, attenuation and intensity. As there isn't a convenience class for colour as of yet, Vector3f is being used instead for the meantime. Vector3f(float x, float y, float z)

    BaseLight's colour like so: Colour(RBG) float x = R float y = G float z = B

    Example: new SpotLight(new Vector3f(0,1,1), 0.4f, new Attenuation(0,0,0.1f), 0.7f) Returns a SpotLight With RGB(0, 1, 1) intensity of 0.4f and Attenuation with constant and linear values 0 but exponential value of 0.1f and cutoff value of 0.7f.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SpotLight

        public SpotLight(Vector3f colour,
                 float intensity,
                 Attenuation attenuation,
                 float cutoff)
        Constructs and initialises the SpotLight specified colour, intensity, cutoff and attenuation. It's shader is automatically set to Forward-spot.vs and Forward-spot.fs.Therefore requires the shaders in order to work.
        Parameters:
        colour - The SpotLight's colour(RGB) Example: new Vector(1, 1, 1) for white colour
        intensity - The SpotLight's intensity
        attenuation - The SpotLight's attenuation Example: new Attenuation(0, 0, 1)

        Attenuation is composed of a constant, a linear and an exponent, like so: Attenuation(float constant, float linear, floar exponent)

        cutoff - The SpotLight's cutoff point
